file_insights.key_details: Defines blog metadata (site URL, name, description), Google Analytics setup, and future CMS integration placeholders
Extends Next.js core-web-vitals and prettier configs with strict TypeScript rules, console restrictions, and const enforcement
Standard Next.js ignores including node_modules, .next, build artifacts, env files, and OS-specific files
Enforces consistent formatting with Tailwind CSS plugin support, 80 character width, semicolons, and LF line endings
Comprehensive overview including tech stack (Next.js 14, TypeScript, Tailwind), features (SEO, MDX, Analytics), project structure, deployment info, and performance targets
Enables MDX support, strict mode, configures image remotePatterns for all HTTPS hosts, sets page extensions
Next.js 14.2.25, MDX support, Tailwind CSS, analytics, content processing libraries (gray-matter, reading-time, rehype plugins), dev tools
Chains Tailwind CSS and autoprefixer for CSS processing
Dark mode support, color system using CSS variables, typography plugin, animation utilities, responsive container settings
Strict mode enabled, path aliases (@/*), unused variable detection, no unreachable code, isolated modules, incremental builds

patterns_discovered.description: Multiple strict compiler options enabled (noUnusedLocals, noUnusedParameters, noFallthroughCasesInSwitch)

gotchas_discovered.description: tsconfig.json defines @/* path pointing to ./src/*, but project structure docs reference ./app/ and ./components/ directories without src/
gotchas_discovered.impact: Path imports using @/* may fail if files aren't in src/ subdirectories
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Either adjust path alias to match actual directory structure or ensure all source files are organized under src/

gotchas_discovered.description: tailwind.config.js includes './src/**/*.{js,ts,jsx,tsx,mdx}' but project uses ./app and ./components at root
gotchas_discovered.impact: Tailwind may not process styles correctly if content globs don't match actual file locations
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Verify content paths match the actual app structure during next steps

gotchas_discovered.description: package.json specifies port 3001 for dev and start commands
gotchas_discovered.impact: May conflict with other services on port 3001; requires custom scripts to use different port
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Use PORT environment variable override or document port requirement

gotchas_discovered.description: next.config.js allows all HTTPS hostnames with '**' pattern
gotchas_discovered.impact: Could enable image hotlinking from untrusted sources; no protection against external image abuse
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Restrict to specific trusted domains once known

gotchas_discovered.description: README documents detailed app/ structure but no actual directories or files created yet
gotchas_discovered.impact: Project won't run until directory structure is implemented
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Next step must include creating app/, components/, content/ directories with minimum viable files
